org.buildmlearn.appstore.utils

Class SlidingTabLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • android.widget.HorizontalScrollView
            • org.buildmlearn.appstore.utils.SlidingTabLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class SlidingTabLayout
extends android.widget.HorizontalScrollView
    Helper class which extends to HorizontalScrollView, and sets the layout of the Tabs.

        context - Context Object of the current Activity.
        attrs - AttributeSet Object
        defStyle - Default Style Object

    • Method Detail

      • setCustomTabColorizer

        public void setCustomTabColorizer(SlidingTabLayout.TabColorizer tabColorizer)
        Set the custom SlidingTabLayout.TabColorizer to be used. If you only require simple customisation then you can use setSelectedIndicatorColors(int...) to achieve similar effects.

      • setDistributeEvenly

        public void setDistributeEvenly()
        Distributes the tabs evenly in the available space.

      • setSelectedIndicatorColors

        public void setSelectedIndicatorColors(int... colors)
        Sets the colors to be used for indicating the selected tab. These colors are treated as a circular array. Providing one color will mean that all tabs are indicated with the same color.

      • setOnPageChangeListener

        public void setOnPageChangeListener(android.support.v4.view.ViewPager.OnPageChangeListener listener)
        Set the ViewPager.OnPageChangeListener. When using SlidingTabLayout you are required to set any ViewPager.OnPageChangeListener through this method. This is so that the layout can update it's scroll position correctly.
        See Also:
        ViewPager.setOnPageChangeListener(ViewPager.OnPageChangeListener)

      • setCustomTabView

        public void setCustomTabView(int layoutResId,
                             int textViewId)
        Set the custom layout to be inflated for the tab views.
        Parameters:
        layoutResId - Layout id to be inflated
        textViewId - id of the TextView in the inflated view

      • setViewPager

        public void setViewPager(android.support.v4.view.ViewPager viewPager)
        Sets the associated view pager. Note that the assumption here is that the pager content (number of tabs and tab titles) does not change after this call has been made.

      • createDefaultTabView

        private android.widget.TextView createDefaultTabView(android.content.Context context)
        Create a default view to be used for tabs. This is called if a custom tab view is not set via setCustomTabView(int, int).

      • populateTabStrip

        private void populateTabStrip()
        Populates tabs strip

        public void setContentDescription(int i,
                                  java.lang.String desc)
        Sets the description to the Content Description property as the xml attribute to the view.
        Parameters:
        i - Current Index
        desc - Description in String

                         int positionOffset)
        Scrolls the tabs
        Parameters:

        positionOffset - Offset applied to the current tab
